dialog.text: I want to discover who I am beyond the noise—what journaling prompts actually help with self-discovery?
dialog.instructions: tone: curious and earnest; pace: medium; intonation: rising at the end to invite response

dialog.text: Prompts are listening rooms for your inner voice. Start small and breathe before you write.
dialog.instructions: tone: warm, calm; pace: steady; emphasis on listening and breath

dialog.text: Give me a set I can try today.

Here’s a starter pack you can read aloud: 1) What did I feel today, and where did that come from? 2) When did I act most like myself, and what sparked it? 3) What am I avoiding, and why? 4) If this feeling had a name, what would it be? 5) What would I tell my future self this week?
dialog.instructions: tone: instructional yet inviting; pace: measured; emphasis on each prompt; slightly dramatic to highlight prompts

dialog.text: Okay, I’ll test them. But will I hear real change or just answers?
dialog.instructions: tone: hopeful but cautious; pace: even

dialog.text: Change starts when you listen to the not-yet-asked questions, not just the easy ones.
dialog.instructions: tone: insightful; pace: slow; emphasis on ‘not-yet-asked questions’

dialog.text: So the practice is not to solve me, but to keep uncovering me.
Journaling isn’t a destination, it’s a daily practice of noticing what matters.
If you try these prompts for a week, share one prompt that surprised you in the comments and start a small conversation about self-discovery.
dialog.instructions: tone: inviting; pace: moderate; clear call to action
